title: Remove API access and webhooks functionality
description:
Remove or deprecate API access and webhooks features from the platform:

SCOPE ASSESSMENT:
- Identify all existing API endpoints for external access
- Identify all webhook implementations
- Review current usage (if any)
- Assess impact on existing integrations
- Determine deprecation timeline

API ACCESS REMOVAL:
- Remove API key generation functionality
- Remove API key authentication middleware
- Remove API key management UI
- Delete API key database tables
- Remove API documentation pages
- Remove API-specific routes and endpoints
- Clean up API-related environment variables

WEBHOOK REMOVAL:
- Remove webhook subscription endpoints
- Remove webhook delivery service
- Remove webhook signature generation
- Delete webhook subscriptions from database
- Remove webhook configuration UI
- Remove webhook event logging
- Stop webhook retry jobs/workers

DATABASE CLEANUP:
- Drop api_keys table (if exists)
- Drop webhook_subscriptions table (if exists)
- Drop webhook_events table (if exists)
- Drop webhook_delivery_log table (if exists)
- Remove API-related columns from other tables
- Clean up orphaned records

AFFECTED INTEGRATIONS:
- Review Zapier integration dependencies
  * May need to keep minimal webhook support for Zapier
  * Or migrate to different integration approach
- Check QuickBooks integration
- Check Google Calendar integration
- Check Stripe webhook handling (keep - required for Stripe)
- Identify any custom integrations using API

CODE REMOVAL:
Files/modules to remove or update:
- /lib/api/ directory (if exists)
- /lib/webhooks/ directory (if exists)
- /app/routes/api/ - external API routes
- /app/routes/settings/api-keys.tsx (if exists)
- /app/routes/settings/webhooks.tsx (if exists)
- API authentication middleware
- Webhook delivery service
- API rate limiting logic
- Webhook signature verification

SETTINGS/UI CLEANUP:
- Remove API Keys page from settings menu
- Remove Webhooks page from settings menu
- Remove API documentation links
- Update settings navigation
- Remove API-related form components
- Remove webhook configuration forms

JOBS/WORKERS:
- Remove webhook delivery worker
- Remove webhook retry job
- Remove API usage tracking job
- Clean up job queue configurations
- Update worker processes

SECURITY CLEANUP:
- Remove API key hashing utilities
- Remove webhook signature generation
- Remove API-scoped permissions
- Update security documentation
- Remove API-related audit logs (or archive)

ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES:
Remove or deprecate:
- API_ENABLED
- API_RATE_LIMIT_*
- WEBHOOK_SIGNING_SECRET
- API_VERSION
- Update .env.example
- Update deployment configurations

MIGRATION PATH (if keeping some functionality):
- If keeping Zapier webhooks:
  * Separate Zapier-specific webhook implementation
  * Use internal webhook system only
  * Document Zapier as special case
  
- If keeping Stripe webhooks:
  * Keep /api/webhooks/stripe endpoint
  * Remove generic webhook framework
  * Stripe webhooks are internal, not user-configurable

DOCUMENTATION UPDATES:
- Remove API documentation pages
- Remove webhook setup guides
- Update integration documentation
- Add deprecation notice (if phased removal)
- Update changelog
- Update README

TESTING:
- Remove API endpoint tests
- Remove webhook delivery tests
- Remove API authentication tests
- Update integration tests
- Verify existing functionality still works
- Test that removed endpoints return 404

COMMUNICATION (if users affected):
- Deprecation announcement
- Migration timeline
- Alternative solutions
- Support for affected users
- Email notifications to API key holders

ALTERNATIVES TO CONSIDER:
Instead of complete removal, consider:
- Keep internal webhooks only (for system integrations)
- Keep read-only API for specific use cases
- Implement OAuth for future integrations
- Use Zapier as the official integration method

PHASED REMOVAL (if needed):
Phase 1 (Week 1-2):
- Mark features as deprecated
- Add deprecation warnings to UI
- Communicate to users
- Provide migration guides

Phase 2 (Week 3-4):
- Disable new API key creation
- Disable new webhook subscriptions
- Existing keys/webhooks still work

Phase 3 (Week 5-6):
- Remove UI components
- Archive existing API keys
- Stop webhook deliveries

Phase 4 (Week 7-8):
- Remove backend code
- Drop database tables
- Final cleanup

ROLLBACK PLAN:
- Database backup before table drops
- Code branch before removal
- Feature flag to re-enable if needed
- Timeline for decision to rollback

EXCEPTIONS TO KEEP:
✓ Stripe webhooks - Required for payment processing
  * Keep /api/webhooks/stripe
  * Keep Stripe webhook verification
  
✓ Internal system webhooks (if used)
  * Job completion notifications
  * System event broadcasts
  
? Zapier webhooks - Decide based on Zapier integration plans
  * If Zapier integration stays, keep minimal webhook support
  * Or migrate to Zapier Platform REST Hooks

FILES TO REVIEW:
- lib/integrations/zapier.server.ts
- app/routes/api/webhooks/
- Database schema files
- Authentication middleware
- Integration documentation

title: Fully implement Zapier integration for workflow automation
description:
Complete Zapier integration to enable no-code workflow automation and third-party app connections:

ZAPIER APP PLATFORM:
- Build official DiveStreams Zapier app
- Submit to Zapier App Directory
- Public vs Private app versions
- App branding and description
- Category selection (Business Management, CRM)
- Support and documentation links

AUTHENTICATION:
- Implement API Key authentication for Zapier
- OAuth2 authentication option (future enhancement)
- Secure key generation and management
- Key rotation/revocation
- Per-organization API keys
- Scoped permissions (read vs write)
- Test authentication endpoint

TRIGGERS (Send data FROM DiveStreams TO other apps):
- New Booking Created
  * Trigger when customer books a trip
  * Sample data: customer name, email, trip details, booking number
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/bookings/new
  
- Booking Status Changed
  * Trigger on confirmed/cancelled/completed status
  * Include previous and new status
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/bookings/status-changed
  
- New Customer Created
  * Trigger when new customer registers
  * Customer profile data
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/customers/new
  
- Payment Received
  * Trigger on successful payment
  * Payment amount, method, booking reference
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/payments/received
  
- Trip Fully Booked
  * Trigger when trip reaches capacity
  * Trip details and waitlist info
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/trips/fully-booked
  
- Review Submitted
  * Trigger when customer submits review
  * Review rating, text, customer info
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/reviews/new
  
- Equipment Rental
  * Trigger on equipment rental
  * Equipment details, rental period
  * Polling URL: GET /api/zapier/triggers/equipment/rented

ACTIONS (Send data FROM other apps TO DiveStreams):
- Create Booking
  * Create new booking via Zapier
  * Input: customer details, trip ID, participants
  * Endpoint: POST /api/zapier/actions/bookings/create
  
- Update Booking Status
  * Change booking status (confirm, cancel)
  * Input: booking ID, new status, reason
  * Endpoint: POST /api/zapier/actions/bookings/update-status
  
- Create Customer
  * Add new customer to system
  * Input: name, email, phone, emergency contact
  * Endpoint: POST /api/zapier/actions/customers/create
  
- Add Customer Note
  * Append note to customer profile
  * Input: customer ID, note text, category
  * Endpoint: POST /api/zapier/actions/customers/add-note
  
- Send Email via Template
  * Trigger email to customer using template
  * Input: customer email, template ID, variables
  * Endpoint: POST /api/zapier/actions/emails/send
  
- Add to Waitlist
  * Add customer to trip waitlist
  * Input: customer ID, trip ID
  * Endpoint: POST /api/zapier/actions/waitlist/add

SEARCHES (Find existing data):
- Find Booking
  * Search by booking number, customer email, or trip
  * Endpoint: GET /api/zapier/searches/bookings
  
- Find Customer
  * Search by email, phone, or name
  * Endpoint: GET /api/zapier/searches/customers
  
- Find Trip
  * Search by name, date, or location
  * Endpoint: GET /api/zapier/searches/trips

POLLING & WEBHOOKS:
- REST Hooks (recommended by Zapier)
- Implement subscribe/unsubscribe endpoints:
  * POST /api/zapier/hooks/subscribe
  * DELETE /api/zapier/hooks/unsubscribe/:id
- Store webhook subscriptions in database
- Trigger webhooks on relevant events
- Dedupe key for preventing duplicates
- Webhook retry logic (3 attempts, exponential backoff)

API ENDPOINTS:
- GET /api/zapier/auth/test - Test authentication
- GET /api/zapier/triggers/:trigger_name - Polling triggers
- POST /api/zapier/actions/:action_name - Execute actions
- GET /api/zapier/searches/:search_name - Search queries
- POST /api/zapier/hooks/subscribe - Subscribe to webhook
- DELETE /api/zapier/hooks/unsubscribe/:id - Unsubscribe
- GET /api/zapier/schema - Dynamic field schema

DATABASE SCHEMA:
- zapier_api_keys table:
  * organization_id
  * api_key (hashed)
  * key_name
  * scopes (JSON array)
  * last_used_at
  * expires_at
  * created_by_user_id
  * created_at
  * revoked_at

- zapier_webhook_subscriptions table:
  * subscription_id
  * organization_id
  * trigger_name (booking.created, payment.received, etc)
  * target_url (Zapier webhook URL)
  * created_at
  * last_triggered_at
  * is_active

- zapier_event_log table:
  * event_id
  * organization_id
  * trigger_name
  * webhook_url
  * payload (JSON)
  * status (success/failed)
  * status_code
  * error_message
  * triggered_at
  * retry_count

ZAPIER APP CONFIGURATION:
- app.yaml / zapier.json definition
- Trigger definitions with input/output schemas
- Action definitions with input/output schemas
- Search definitions
- Dynamic dropdowns (trips, customers)
- Field help text and placeholders
- Sample data for testing
- Error handling messages

DYNAMIC DROPDOWNS:
- List Trips (for booking actions)
  * Endpoint: GET /api/zapier/dropdowns/trips
  * Return: [{id, name, date}]
  
- List Customers (for note actions)
  * Endpoint: GET /api/zapier/dropdowns/customers
  * Return: [{id, name, email}]
  
- List Email Templates
  * Endpoint: GET /api/zapier/dropdowns/email-templates
  * Return: [{id, name, subject}]

SAMPLE DATA:
- Provide realistic sample data for each trigger/action
- Used by Zapier for Zap setup preview
- Should match actual API response format
- Include all possible fields

UI COMPONENTS:
- Zapier integration page in settings
- API key generation interface
- Active Zap viewer (if using Zapier Platform UI)
- Connected apps dashboard
- Event log viewer
- API usage statistics
- Key management (create, revoke, rotate)
- Documentation links

POPULAR ZAP TEMPLATES:
- "New Booking → Add to Google Sheets"
- "New Booking → Send Slack notification"
- "New Customer → Add to Mailchimp"
- "Payment Received → Update QuickBooks"
- "Booking Cancelled → Send cancellation email via Gmail"
- "Trip Fully Booked → Create Google Calendar event"
- "New Review → Post to company Slack channel"

ERROR HANDLING:
- Invalid API key (401 Unauthorized)
- Missing required fields (400 Bad Request)
- Resource not found (404 Not Found)
- Rate limiting (429 Too Many Requests)
- Server errors (500)
- Helpful error messages for Zapier users
- Retry-After headers for rate limits

SECURITY:
- API key hashing in database
- Rate limiting per organization
- Input validation and sanitization
- SQL injection prevention
- CSRF not needed (API-only)
- Webhook signature verification (optional)
- Scope-based permissions
- Audit logging

RATE LIMITING:
- 100 requests per minute per API key
- 5000 requests per day per organization
- Return 429 with Retry-After header
- Communicate limits in Zapier app docs

TESTING:
- Unit tests for all triggers/actions/searches
- Integration tests with Zapier CLI
- Test webhook subscriptions
- Test dynamic dropdowns
- Test deduplication
- Test error scenarios
- Load testing for popular triggers

DOCUMENTATION:
- Zapier app setup guide
- Authentication instructions
- Available triggers/actions/searches
- Field descriptions and examples
- Common Zap templates
- Troubleshooting guide
- API rate limits
- Changelog for app updates
- Environment variables:
  * ZAPIER_API_ENABLED (true/false)
  * ZAPIER_RATE_LIMIT_PER_MINUTE
  * ZAPIER_RATE_LIMIT_PER_DAY

MONITORING:
- Track Zapier API usage per organization
- Monitor webhook delivery success rate
- Alert on high failure rates
- Track most popular triggers/actions
- Performance metrics (response times)

ZAPIER PLATFORM TOOLS:
- Use Zapier Platform CLI for development
- zapier test - Run tests
- zapier validate - Validate app definition
- zapier push - Deploy to Zapier
- zapier promote - Promote to production
- zapier logs - View production logs

SUBMISSION & REVIEW:
- Zapier app submission checklist
- App review process preparation
- Beta testing phase
- Public launch preparation
- Zapier brand guidelines compliance

title: Fix public site 404 errors and improve disabled site handling
description:
Fix various 404 errors and improve handling when public site is disabled or missing pages:

IDENTIFIED ISSUES:

1. MISSING ROUTES (404s):
- /site/equipment - Navigation shows link but route doesn't exist
- /site/gallery - Navigation shows link but route doesn't exist

2. DISABLED SITE REDIRECT:
File: app/routes/site/_layout.tsx (line 197)
Current behavior:
- Redirects to /?site=disabled when public site is disabled
- This likely 404s or shows wrong page

Suggested fix:
- Create dedicated /site-disabled page
- Show branded "Coming Soon" message
- Include organization name and contact info
- Option to sign up for notifications when site launches

3. NAVIGATION SHOWS DISABLED PAGES:
The layout navigation includes links to equipment and gallery even when:
- The routes don't exist (always 404)
- The pages are disabled in settings

Fix:
- Navigation already checks enabledPages
- But routes don't exist, so clicks result in 404
- Need to implement missing routes OR hide from nav entirely

4. MISSING ERROR BOUNDARY:
No custom 404 page for public site routes
- Should show branded 404 with org theme
- Suggest other pages to visit
- Search functionality
- Link back to home

IMPLEMENTATION PLAN:

Phase 1: Quick Fix (hide broken links)
- Remove equipment and gallery from navigation until routes exist
- OR disable these page toggles in settings until implemented

Phase 2: Proper Disabled Site Handling
- Create app/routes/site-disabled.tsx
- Update redirect in _layout.tsx
- Style with minimal branding
- Show organization contact info if available

Phase 3: 404 Error Boundary
- Create app/routes/site/$.tsx (catch-all route)
- Custom 404 page with site theme
- Helpful navigation suggestions
- Search functionality

Phase 4: Implement Missing Pages
- See DIVE-k2b for Equipment page
- See DIVE-pif for Gallery page

ADDITIONAL IMPROVEMENTS:

Check Site Status Before Showing Forms:
- Login/register pages should check if site is enabled
- Redirect to main app if site is disabled

Subdomain Resolution Errors:
- Better error message when org not found
- Suggest checking subdomain spelling
- Link to DiveStreams main site

SEO Considerations:
- Proper 404 status codes
- Meta robots noindex for disabled sites
- Canonical URLs

TESTING:
- Test with site enabled and pages disabled
- Test with site disabled
- Test with invalid subdomain
- Test with missing custom domain
- Test navigation to non-existent pages

## Fixes Applied

### Root Causes Identified:
1. No session validation - Enrollment could be created for non-existent sessions (500 errors)
2. No customer validation - Enrollment could reference non-existent customers (FK constraint errors)
3. No capacity check - Sessions could exceed max students
4. No duplicate check - Same customer could be enrolled twice (unique constraint violation = 400 error)
5. No status validation - Could enroll in cancelled sessions
6. Generic error messages - All errors returned 'Failed to create enrollment'

### Changes Made:

#### lib/db/training.server.ts - createEnrollment()
Added comprehensive validation before creating enrollment:
- Validate session exists and get status/capacity
- Reject enrollments for cancelled sessions
- Check if session is full (enrolledCount >= maxStudents)
- Validate customer exists
- Check for duplicate enrollment
- Specific error messages for each failure case

#### app/routes/tenant/training/enrollments/new.tsx
- Fixed loader to properly handle customers pagination result
- Enhanced error handling with specific user-friendly messages
- Errors now show root cause to users

### Status Support:
Allowed: scheduled, in_progress, completed sessions
Blocked: cancelled sessions

### Tests:
Created enrollment-validation.test.ts with 8 comprehensive test cases
